New Records: Shohei Ohtani moved closer to becoming the first player in major league history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season
Key Match Events: Gavin Lux singled in the go-ahead run with two outs in the seventh inning
Tommy Edman homered for the fourth time in 24 hours
Will Smith doubled off Shawn Armstrong in the seventh and scored on Lux’s single to center
Bellinger hit a three-run shot in the fifth that chased Miller and left Chicago trailing 7-6
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers walked 10 batters, including four by starter Bobby Miller
Post-Match Reflections: Max Muncy said, “It was frustrating again, but it’s baseball. Not everything is going to be clicking at the same time,”
Dave Roberts said, “Tommy is otherworldly these days,”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs outscored the Dodgers 16-7 in winning the first two games
The Dodgers blew a lead for the second straight game
The Dodgers blew a 7-3 lead to beat the Chicago Cubs 10-8
Others: Michael Kopech loaded the bases on consecutive walks to Dansby Swanson, Seiya Suzuki and former Dodger Cody Bellinger
Kopech was called for a pitch-clock violation, giving an automatic ball to Isaac Paredes, whose sacrifice fly cut Chicago’s deficit to 10-8
